p.strong: Update: April 9, Drive-Thru Wireless Access Areas

span.p: Purpose: Mount Markham is excited to announce the rollout of 'drive-thru' or 'parking lot' wireless access areas. The purpose of this access is to assist those that may not have high-speed wireless access at home and who could benefit from its availability on our campus. Parents without home internet access are encouraged to contact their child's school office to learn more about this opportunity and how their child can go about utilizing this option.

Process: Students with a school-issued Chromebook, will be able to access the school's internet from one of three locations at the Elementary School and Middle School. Access will be available from 7:00am-7:00pm. We ask that students be supervised, and that everyone continue to practice safe social distancing guidelines. At no time should students be congregating in groups or left unsupervised by adults.

How-To: The document linked below will provide a quick guide on where and how to access these wireless access areas. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to John-Henry Lane at jlane@mmcsd.org. He and the IT team will connect with you as soon as possible.
We thank you for your support, and we hope this opportunity proves valuable to our students.
Below, please find several updates for the Mount Markham CSD Community.

New York State Schools shall remain closed through April 29. We are hopeful that students and staff will return to school on Thursday, April 30. During the closure, school offices are open from 10am-2PM. All school offices will be closed on Friday, April 10.

We are grateful for the community's efforts to prevent the spread of COVID-19. To the extent possible, please stay home, practice social distancing, cover your nose and mouth when sneezing or coughing, wash your hands frequently and wear a mask or scarf when you must interact with the general public.

During this extended closure, we are grateful for the collaboration occurring between our instructional staff and our parents to continue academic learning. We are also proud of the efforts of our students! Instructional staff are updating learning materials via Google Classroom or paper learning packets. Paper learning packets can be picked up at your child's school office. If necessary, paper learning packets can be delivered to your home. Please contact 315-822-2800 to contact a school office.

The district is excited to share that drive through internet access is being provided at the middle school and elementary school. Internet access is provided using school Chromebook devices only. Parents without home internet access are encouraged to contact their child's school office to learn more about this opportunity. More information will be available on our website shortly.

During the closure, free breakfast and lunches are being distributed. You can pick up the free meals at multiple locations between 11:30am and 1PM. If necessary, free meals can be delivered to our home. Contact your child's school office to arrange delivery. Double meals will be distributed on April 9. There will be no food delivery on Friday, April 10.

This virus represents an unprecedented challenge to every citizen from every country. This week is a holy week for many. We know that Passover and Easter celebrations cannot occur as they may have; but we hope that the more solemn remembrances are meaningful for you and your family.
The school campus is quiet, too quiet. We miss our students and we hope that our hallways will be filled with the joyful laughter of our students and staff soon. Until then, please be safe.
Thank you,
Paul Berry, Superintendent of Schools

p.strong: Update: April 9, Eseential Worker Child Care Support

span.p: During the New York State Pause, Governor Cuomo has asked school district to support the coordination of child care services for essential workers.

If you believe that you may qualify, please call the Oneida-Herkimer-Madison Child Care Resource Center at 315-223-7850 extension 222. You may also complete this parent need for child care survey. Based on the information you provide about your job, employer, number of children, and financial need, assistance may be provided.
For further information: http://cceoneida.com/child-care-council

Mount Markham has collaborated with the OHM BOCES Food Service to begin community distribution of bagged lunch and breakfast items. Mount Markham will be providing a free lunch and breakfast for the following day, to any child under the age of 18 at the following locations. Food will be distributed from 11:30am to 1:00pm, Monday to Friday. Food will be disributed at the following locations.

ul.li: Mount Markham High School Cafeteria (Bus Loop Door)

span.p: We will also have a school bus at the following locations to distribute meals from 11:30am -1:00pm. (Times are approximate)

If you are in need of lunches during our closure and cannot get to a site, please contact your school office or email Pfoss@mmcsd.org. We will arrange for them to be delivered. Please allow 24 hours for delivery to begin.
Elmentary Main Office: 315-822-2840
Middle School Main Office:315-822-2870
High School Main Office: 315-822-2900

It Is important that parents and students traveling to one of these locations not assemble in large groups. Please practice social distancing (What is social distancing?) at these sites. We are grateful to staff from each location that will make this distribution of food to our students possible.
Please do not hesitate to contact a school office with questions or to identify a need.

p.strong: Servicio de comida a domicilio programado:

br.br:
Mount Markham ha colaborado con el servicio de alimentos OHM BOCES para comenzar la distribución comunitaria de almuerzos y desayunos envasados. Mount Markham proveerá un almuerzo y desayuno para el día siguiente gratis a cualquier niño menor de 18 años. Los alimentos serán distribuidos de 11:30 a.m. a 1:00 p.m., de lunes a viernes, en estos lugares:
La cafetería de la escuela secundaria Mount Markham (la puerta exterior este cerca de la entrada)
Centro Comunitario Leonardsville (Leonardsville Community & Ministry Center)
Ayuntamiento de Bridgewater (Bridgewater Town Hall)
Ayuntamiento de Litchfield (Litchfield Town Hall)
Cedarhurst Trailer Park Cedarville
También tendremos un autobús escolar en los siguientes lugares para distribuir comidas de 11:30 a.m. a 1:00 p.m. (Las horas son aproximadas)
Pine Village Estates - 11:00am
Williams Mobile Home Park - 11:30am
Brookside Mobile Home Park - 12:00pm
Valley View Mobile Home Park - 12:30pm
Si necesita estos alimentos durante nuestro cierre y no puede ir a un sitio, comuníquese con la oficina de su escuela o envíe un correo electrónico (Email) a Pfoss@mmcsd.org. Arreglaremos para que sean entregados. Por favor espere 24 horas para que comience la entrega.

span.p: We're excited to annouce the launch of our 'Virtual Learning Resources' Google Site. This website will be used to share digital resources, and to provide support for teachers, students, and parents.
Please visit our site, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions or concerns.

In consultation with the Herkimer County Health Department, a decision has been made to close the component schools of the Herkimer BOCES, including Mount Markham Central School. All schools within the BOCES will be closed from March 16 and returning on Thursday, April 29.
Please see the attachment for information from the Herkimer BOCES District Superintendent, Sandra Sherwood.
We will continue to post additonal resources as they become available.
